DownTYU, the question about the 2 audio tracks is a legit problem because those of us who are using a media server to stream our mkv's, can't choose a track that we want to listen to. It goes straight to the German track, and it is the same problem with a lot of these 3D movies. Most of us DO have high end 3D blu ray players but do not want to be burning discs. Make sense?
Thanks by the way for the amazing upload. Great quality.

BFF:  PS3 will not play this file format directly.  It is an MKV and must be converted to one of the many other formats that work just fine on PS3 (but no one seems to ever want to upload).  There is a program called MKV2VOB that can help with that conversion, however in the case of this and a few other 3D uploads, they keep putting a non-English language track as the primary audio, and we can't seem to find a way to convert with just the English on there.

ok, for everyone here who is having troubles.

First off - if you don't have a 3DTV or 3D capable PC Monitor - don't even bother downloading this.  It will be a waste of your bandwith to download something you can't watch.

For people who are having trouble playing the movie.  Once you start the movie, it's going to look all distorted and you will see double images.  This is because the movie is being played in Side By Side 3D.  You need to switch your TV over to Side By Side mode and it will make everything look normal.  Since it's not a bluray disc, your TV will not automatically detect that it's a 3D file and make the switch.
